channel.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: US Elections News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: When NYU friends asked Barron Trump who he voted for he says he doesn't ...
item.description: Barron Trump, son of former President Donald Trump, has reportedly surprised his NYU peers by declining to reveal his political stance, stating he "doesn't support any party." Despite this, sources close to the family suggest Barron played a key role in his father's 2024 campaign, particularly in connecting him with influential podcasters to reach a younger demographic.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Rick Scott, GOP Senator endorsed by Elon Musk for Senate majority leader
item.description: Elon Musk has endorsed Republican Senator Rick Scott for Senate majority leader. Scott is vying for the position against Senators John Thune and John Cornyn. Trump stated that any Republican Senator seeking the leadership position must agree to recess appointments. Scott agreed and pledged to get Trump's nominations through quickly.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indian American Democratic fundraiser receives racist messages
item.description: Ajay Jain Bhutoria, an Indian American and Democratic Party fundraiser, has been targeted with racist and threatening messages urging him to return to India. The messages, sent from an unknown number, accused Bhutoria of prioritizing Indian interests over American ones.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump slams Democrats for involving Liz Cheney in 2024 election campaign
item.description: Former President Donald Trump criticised the Democratic Party for involving former Republican Representative Liz Cheney and her father, Dick Cheney, in their 2024 campaign. Trump believes their involvement will negatively impact the Democrats and that bringing "losers" into a campaign is unwise. He also referred to Liz Cheney as a "war hawk" for her past support of military intervention.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Twin earthquakes shake Cuba in wake of recent hurricanes, blackouts
item.description: Two strong earthquakes, registering magnitudes of 5.9 and 6.8, struck off the coast of southern Cuba, causing panic and damage to buildings and infrastructure. The quakes occurred just days after Hurricanes Rafael and Oscar impacted the island, compounding the difficulties faced by residents already grappling with power outages and an economic crisis.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump pressures candidates for Senate GOP leader to allow ‘recess appointments’
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump urged the next Senate Republican leader to back the use of "recess appointments" to expedite Cabinet confirmations. Trump emphasized the need to fill positions swiftly and prevent delays similar to his first term. The three candidates vying for the leadership position expressed openness to Trump's suggestion, highlighting the significance of his endorsement.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan Railways suspends train services to and from Quetta station after explosion
item.description: Following a deadly explosion at Quetta railway station that claimed 26 lives and injured 62, Pakistan Railways has suspended train services to and from the station until November 14th. The blast occurred during the departure of the Jaffar Express, with numerous passengers present.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump has said he won’t be a dictator ‘except for Day 1’: A look at his to-do list
item.description: Upon a potential return to the White House, Donald Trump has outlined a series of immediate actions for his first day and second term. These include dismissing legal cases against him, enacting mass deportations of undocumented immigrants, pardoning those involved in the January 6th Capitol riot, and dismantling the perceived "deep state.

item.title: Who gets to keep the ring if engagement’s off? US court rules always the buyer
item.description: A Massachusetts court ruled that a man is entitled to the return of a $70,000 engagement ring he gave his former fiancée. The ruling overturns a decades-old precedent that required judges to determine who was at fault for the breakup in such cases.

item.title: 50,000 Russian & North Korean troops mass ahead of attack, say US & Ukrainian officials
item.description: Russia is assembling a large force, including North Korean troops, in the Kursk region, preparing for a major offensive to reclaim lost territory. This development coincides with President-elect Trump's goal of quickly ending the war, while some US officials express growing concern over Ukraine's ability to withstand the Russian advance.

item.title: Bangladesh to seek Interpol alert for Hasina; ‘genocide’ plaint against Yunus at ICC
item.description: Bangladesh's interim government will seek Interpol's help to extradite former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and her allies to face charges related to alleged crimes against humanity. The government alleges their involvement in killings during student protests that led to Hasina's removal.

item.title: US supreme court justice Sonia Sotomayor has no plans to resign despite calls for succession
item.description: Supreme Court Justice Sonia Sotomayor has dismissed suggestions that she should resign from her position, despite calls from some progressive voices for her to step down. Sotomayor, the first Hispanic and third woman to serve on the Supreme Court, remains in good health and committed to her role, according to sources close to her.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump urges Putin not to escalate Ukraine war in phone call: Reports
item.description: Former US President Donald Trump advised Russian President Vladimir Putin against escalating the war in Ukraine during a phone call. Trump emphasized the US military presence in Europe. Ukraine denied prior knowledge of the call. Meanwhile, National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan affirmed President Biden's commitment to supporting Ukraine during the transition.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden to urge Trump 'not walk away from Ukraine' in key meeting
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump and President Joe Biden are scheduled to meet on Wednesday to discuss critical domestic and international policy matters, including the ongoing war in Ukraine. National security adviser Jake Sullivan revealed that Biden will emphasize the importance of a smooth power transition and advocate for continued support for Ukraine, a stance opposed by Trump and some Republican lawmakers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: New York Parks employee dies while battling wildfire in Orange Country
item.description: An 18-year-old New York parks employee tragically lost his life to a falling tree while combating a wildfire raging along the New York-New Jersey border. This fire, one of several sparked by dry conditions, has consumed thousands of acres, prompting air quality warnings in both states. Firefighters are battling to contain the blaze, which threatens numerous structures.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ​'I wish him...': Nikki Haley responds to her exclusion from Trump's administration
item.description: Former US Ambassador Nikki Haley and former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo will not be part of Donald Trump's new administration, as confirmed by Trump himself. Despite this, Haley expressed her well wishes for Trump's success in her statement on X. Both were considered potential candidates for cabinet positions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'A pragmatic way': Vivek Ramaswamy backs Trump's mass deportation plans
item.description: Vivek Ramaswamy, a staunch supporter of Donald Trump, has voiced his support for the proposed mass deportation plan, deeming it a practical solution aligned with public sentiment. He emphasized prioritizing the deportation of illegal immigrants convicted of crimes, which he believes would constitute the most extensive deportation in history.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Amsterdam police use hologram to solve murder mystery of young sex worker
item.description: Amsterdam police are using a hologram of Bernadett Szabó, a Hungarian sex worker murdered in 2009, to seek new leads in her unsolved case. Szabó, a young mother, was found stabbed to death in her Red Light District workroom. Despite an extensive investigation, her killer remains unidentified.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Masked man tries to snatch Jewish child from father's arms in New York
item.description: A man attempted to kidnap a six-year-old boy from his father on a Brooklyn sidewalk on Saturday afternoon. The incident, caught on video, shows the suspect grabbing the child and lifting him into the air before the father intervened. The suspect fled and no injuries were reported. Police are investigating the incident.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: YouTuber Johnny Somali apologises for kissing statue honoring Korean wartime victims
item.description: American YouTuber Johnny Somali faces backlash and a police investigation in South Korea after posting a video of himself kissing a statue honoring Korean victims of wartime sexual slavery. Despite issuing an apology, Somali's sincerity is questioned due to other controversial content remaining on his social media accounts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
